questions.text: A technology company is testing a new sensor designed to measure ambient light intensity and its effect on plant growth. The sensor readings are taken at different light intensities (X) and corresponding plant growth measurements (Y) are recorded. The data is then plotted on a graph as shown in the figure below. What conclusion can be drawn from the plot?

options.label: A
options.text: There is a spurious correlation between the two variables

options.label: B
options.text: There is a constant negative correlation between two variables

options.label: C
options.text: There is a constant positive correlation between two variables

questions.correct_answer: C. There is a constant positive correlation between two variables
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) There is a constant positive correlation between two variables

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ A positive correlation is indicated in a scatter plot when an upward trend is observed, with the correlation coefficient (r) ranging between 0 and +1, showing that as one variable increases, the other does as well.

questions.text: A 38-year-old public health expert is evaluating various health indicators to assess the health status of a state and district wise the availability and utilization of health services. Which indicator is considered the best for this purpose?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) IMR (Infant Mortality Rate)

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Infant Mortality Rate (IMR) is a key indicator for evaluating the health status of a population and the availability, utilization, and quality of health services

questions.text: A second year medical student is developing a presentation on the evolution of rural healthcare delivery in India. She needs to highlight the committee’s that recommended the three-tier system of Panchayati raj system in India. Which committee made this recommendation?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Balwant Rai Mehta Committee

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The Balwant Rai Mehta Committee introduced the three-tier Panchayati Raj system in India, which includes the Panchayat at the village level, Panchayat Samiti at the block level, and Zilla Parishad at the district level, to facilitate decentralized governance and rural healthcare delivery.

questions.text: An epidemiologist is conducting ecological investigations to study the health outcomes of different communities. In this type of research, what is considered the observational unit?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Population

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In ecological studies, the population (or group) is the primary observational unit, and the findings may not be applicable to individual members within the population due to the potential for ecological fallacy.

questions.text: A 34-year-old infectious disease specialist is studying the geographic distribution of Kala-Azar in India. She notes that this disease is endemic in several regions. Which of the following regions is not endemic for Kala-Azar?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Madhya Pradesh

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The four major endemic regions for Kala-Azar in India are Bihar, Jharkhand, Uttar Pradesh, and West Bengal. The primary vector, sandfly, thrives in specific environmental conditions found in these states, making them susceptible to the spread of Kala-Azar.

questions.text: As a researcher at an infectious diseases institute, you are developing an educational module for both rural and urban populations on the transmission of communicable diseases. To ensure accurate information, you need to identify which of the following is not considered a direct method of disease transmission?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Droplet nuclei

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The difference between direct and indirect methods of disease transmission. Direct transmission includes mechanisms like vertical transmission, contact with soil, and droplet transmission, while indirect transmission includes droplet nuclei, which are airborne particles that facilitate long-distance spread.

questions.text: According to the WHO, what percentage of immunization coverage is required to achieve the goal of measles eradication?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) 96%

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The WHO recommends 96% immunization coverage as the threshold for achieving measles eradication, reflecting the need for extensive community immunity to prevent outbreaks. Additionally, the WHO's Immunization Agenda 2030 emphasizes equitable access to vaccines, aiming for broad coverage without leaving any groups unprotected.

questions.text: A 26-year-old woman in her second trimester of pregnancy, who has a 2-year-old child and was fully vaccinated in her previous pregnancy, comes in for her vaccination update. What is the recommended vaccination regimen for her?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C)

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ A fully vaccinated pregnant woman who returns within three years requires only a Td booster dose to maintain immunity. This is a standard recommendation to protect both the mother and the newborn from tetanus.

questions.text: A 32-year-old biostatistician is analyzing different statistical methods for a study involving non-normally distributed data. Which of the following statements is true regarding non-parametric tests?

options.label: A
options.text: ANOVA is an example of a non-parametric test

options.label: B
options.text: It is used for skewed distributions

options.label: C
options.text: It involves the assumption that the data has a normal distribution

options.label: D
options.text: It cannot be used for small sample sizes

questions.correct_answer: B. It is used for skewed distributions
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) It is used for skewed distributions

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Non-Parametric Tests are designed for non-normally distributed or skewed data and do not rely on assumptions of normality, making them suitable for a wide range of data types, including small sample sizes.
  • ➤ Non-Parametric Tests

questions.text: A 40-year-old environmental engineer is explaining the functioning of oxidation ponds in wastewater treatment to a group of trainees. He describes how these ponds operate differently during the day and night. Which method do oxidation ponds use?

options.label: C
options.text: Aerobic during the day and anaerobic during the night

options.label: D
options.text: Anaerobic during the day and aerobic during the night

questions.correct_answer: C. Aerobic during the day and anaerobic during the night
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Aerobic during the day and anaerobic during the night

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Oxidation ponds function with aerobic processes during the day (aided by sunlight and algae) and anaerobic processes at night. These ponds are commonly used for wastewater treatment in small communities due to their simplicity and reliance on natural processes.

questions.text: Match the following important public health days with their corresponding dates: Column A 30th January 29th September 16th October 17th November Column B World Heart Day Anti-Leprosy Day World Anesthesia Day National Epilepsy Day
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) 1-b, 2-a, 3-c, 4-d

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ 30th January – Anti-Leprosy Day (b) 29th September – World Heart Day (a) 16th October – World Anesthesia Day (c) 17th November – National Epilepsy Day (d)
  • ➤ 30th January – Anti-Leprosy Day (b)
  • ➤ 30th January
  • ➤ 29th September – World Heart Day (a)
  • ➤ 29th September
  • ➤ 16th October – World Anesthesia Day (c)
  • ➤ 16th October
  • ➤ 17th November – National Epilepsy Day (d)
  • ➤ 17th November

questions.text: Researchers are investigating the prevalence of a particular infectious disease in three towns, each with a different type of water supply. Due to recent outbreaks, nearly all present residents agreed to participate in the study. The researchers calculated and compared the proportion of carriers in each town. What type of study design does this represent?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Cross-sectional study

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ A cross-sectional study is used to measure prevalence at a single point in time and involves primary data collection directly from the population.

questions.text: In a metropolitan area with a population of 750,000, there were 800 deaths recorded in a year. Among these, 56 individuals died from diabetes-related complications. What is the proportional mortality rate from diabetes in this area?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) 7%

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The proportional mortality rate for a specific cause is calculated by dividing deaths from that cause by total deaths and multiplying by 100 to express it as a percentage.

questions.text: A couple has four children, all unvaccinated for measles. One child contracted measles on August 5, 2015, and two other children developed measles by August 15, 2015. What is the secondary attack rate?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) 66%

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The secondary attack rate is calculated by dividing the number of secondary cases by the number of susceptible individuals in close contact with the primary case and multiplying by 100 to express it as a percentage.

questions.text: Compared to a routine case-control study, what major advantage does a nested case-control study provide related to study design?

options.label: A
options.text: It eliminates the need for randomization.

options.label: B
options.text: It allows for better control of confounding bias.

options.label: C
options.text: It ensures temporal association between exposure and outcome.

options.label: D
options.text: It reduces the need for a long follow-up period.

questions.correct_answer: C. It ensures temporal association between exposure and outcome.
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) It ensures temporal association between exposure and outcome.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The nested case-control study’s primary advantage is its ability to ensure temporal association between exposure and outcome, a property retained from its cohort study structure.

questions.text: A 55-year-old man is undergoing evaluation for cardiovascular disease. His physician is interested in understanding the role of lifestyle factors such as diet, exercise, and smoking on the development of cardiovascular disease. The physician decides to design a study to investigate these factors. The systematic distortion of retrospective studies that can be eliminated by a prospective design is:
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Recall bias is commonly associated with retrospective studies and can be minimized by using a prospective study design, which captures exposure information in real-time.

questions.text: A MO is reviewing different agents used in infection control. Which of the following is classified as a disinfectant, but not as a sanitizer?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Bleaching powder

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The distinction between disinfectants, which kill or eliminate pathogens on surfaces, and sanitizers, which reduce microbial load to safe levels.

questions.text: The parents of an 8-month-old child report a history of unusual crying and convulsions following the previous vaccination series, which included BCG, DPT, OPV (first dose), and Hepatitis B. They have now brought the child for the next round of vaccinations. Which vaccine is contraindicated in this situation?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) DPT

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Severe reactions to the pertussis component of DPT, such as unusual crying and convulsions, contraindicate further DPT doses. In such cases, DT should be administered to maintain diphtheria and tetanus immunity without the pertussis component.

questions.text: Which of the following steps is not included in the WHO's STEP approach to chronic disease risk factor surveillance?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Therapeutic assessment

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The WHO STEP approach for NCD risk factor surveillance includes behavioral, physical, and biochemical assessments but does not include therapeutic assessments. This method aims to monitor and control risk factors for chronic diseases, especially in resource-limited settings

questions.text: Researchers conducted a longitudinal study to assess the effects of a new dietary supplement on the development of hypertension. The study revealed a risk ratio of 0.76 for those who took the supplement compared to those who did not. Which statement accurately reflects this finding?

options.label: A
options.text: The supplement increases the risk of hypertension

options.label: B
options.text: The supplement decreases the risk of hypertension

options.label: C
options.text: The data is insufficient to determine a causal relationship

options.label: D
options.text: The value (0.76) is close to 1, indicating no significant effect

questions.correct_answer: B. The supplement decreases the risk of hypertension
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) The supplement decreases the risk of hypertension

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ A risk ratio less than 1 in a cohort study suggests a protective effect of the exposure (in this case, the dietary supplement) against the development of the outcome (hypertension).

questions.text: You are responsible for emergency preparedness at a community health center in a region prone to flooding. What steps would you take to ensure the center is ready for potential flood emergencies? Ensure all necessary resources, including financial and medical supplies, are available Raise public awareness through educational campaigns and community meetings Conduct a flood simulation drill and evaluate the response Follow real-time instructions from emergency management authorities
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) 1, 2, 3

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The essential components of emergency preparedness at a local health center, focusing on resource availability, public education, and response simulation. Real-time instructions from external authorities may not always be feasible or necessary.

questions.text: Under NTEP 2020, which of the following is ICT enabled adherence system?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) DOTS-99

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ DOTS-99 as the ICT-enabled system under NTEP designed specifically for patient adherence monitoring, distinguishing it from tracking or diagnostic tools like NIKSHAY and CBNAAT.
  • ➤ DOTS-99

questions.text: A public health campaign is being developed to educate communities about cancer prevention and screening. As part of the campaign, which type of cancer is identified as one for which routine screening is generally not considered beneficial?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Testicular carcinoma

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Routine screening for testicular carcinoma is generally not beneficial, as it is often detected early through symptom awareness and has a high cure rate, while cancers like colon, breast, and prostate benefit more from regular screening programs.

questions.text: A 32-year-old infectious disease researcher is creating educational materials about rickettsial diseases and their insect vectors. Which of the following pairs of 'Rickettsial Diseases–Insect vectors' is incorrectly matched?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Scrub typhus – Flea

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Typhus Group, Vectors, and Reservoirs
  • ➤ Typhus Group, Vectors, and Reservoirs

questions.text: In a region, health officials report that the prevalence of a certain infectious disease is greater than 5% among high-risk populations but less than 1% among pregnant women. How should this region be classified in terms of disease prevalence?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Moderate prevalence region

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Memorize the classification criteria for disease prevalence in a region: a moderate prevalence region is characterized by over 5% prevalence in high-risk groups and under 1% in pregnant women attending antenatal clinics.

questions.text: Which of the following statements about Yaws is incorrect?

options.label: D
options.text: Cannot be differentiated serologically from Treponema pallidum

questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Spread by sexual transmission

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Yaws is a non-sexually transmitted disease caused by Treponema pertenue and spreads through direct skin contact, unlike syphilis.

questions.text: Which of the following diseases is not transmitted by lice?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Q fever

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Q fever is not transmitted by lice. Instead, it spreads to humans primarily through airborne transmission from infected animals and through the consumption of contaminated milk.

questions.text: A 40-year-old man weighs 75 kg and has a height of 165 cm. What is his Body Mass Index (BMI) and his classification?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) 27 Pre-obese

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Standard BMI classification table based on World Health Organization (WHO) guidelines:
  • ➤ Standard BMI classification table based on World Health Organization (WHO) guidelines:
  • ➤ Detailed BMI Obesity Classification (Class I, II, III)
  • ➤ Detailed BMI Obesity Classification (Class I, II, III)
  • ➤ Obesity Class I: BMI 30.0 - 34.9 Obesity Class II: BMI 35.0 - 39.9 Obesity Class III (Morbid Obesity): BMI 40.0 and above
  • ➤ Obesity Class I: BMI 30.0 - 34.9
  • ➤ Obesity Class II: BMI 35.0 - 39.9
  • ➤ Obesity Class III (Morbid Obesity): BMI 40.0 and above

questions.text: A health policy analyst is assessing indicators to determine the effectiveness of a health system in identifying leprosy cases in the community. Which of the following indicators is least likely to reflect the health system's focus on identifying leprosy?

options.label: B
options.text: Annual new case detection rate per lakh

options.label: D
options.text: Proportion of newly diagnosed patients with grade-2 disability

questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Treatment initiation rate

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In leprosy detection, the annual new case detection rate, treatment completion rate, and proportion of grade-2 disability cases are key indicators of identification success, while the treatment initiation rate is more relevant to case management after diagnosis.

questions.text: A 28-year-old pregnant woman in her second trimester, with a gestational age of 30 weeks, is diagnosed with mild to moderate anemia during her antenatal visit. According to the Anemia Mukt Bharat initiative, what is the recommended treatment for her condition?

options.label: A
options.text: 3 iron and folic acid (IFA) tablets, taken once daily

options.label: B
options.text: IV iron sucrose for non-compliance with oral tablets

options.label: C
options.text: 2 iron and folic acid tablets once daily + IV iron sucrose

questions.correct_answer: B. IV iron sucrose for non-compliance with oral tablets
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) IV iron sucrose for non-compliance with oral tablets

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The treatment for mild to moderate anemia in pregnancy according to Anemia Mukt Bharat is oral iron supplementation; however, IV iron sucrose is recommended if there are compliance concerns or late pregnancy to ensure effective treatment completion.

questions.text: A 45-year-old state epidemiologist is analyzing data related to iodine deficiency disorders (IDD) in the population. She needs to understand the criteria for classifying the severity of goitre in the zones/regions & districts. Which of the following statements about Total Goitre Rate (TGR) is true?

options.label: A
options.text: Divided into three grades: Not visible, Palpable, Visible

options.label: B
options.text: Goitre is classified as endemic if TGR ≥ 10%

options.label: C
options.text: TGR reflects the current status of IDD in the population

options.label: D
options.text: Field survey of TGR does not require doctors

questions.correct_answer: B. Goitre is classified as endemic if TGR ≥ 10%
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Goitre is classified as endemic if TGR ≥ 10%

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Total Goitre Rate (TGR) of 10% or higher classifies a region as endemic for goiter, indicating a significant public health need for iodine deficiency interventions.

questions.text: you are reviewing various national health programs in India for your upcoming seminar. The major interest of seminar is towards the community-based workers. Which National Health Programme includes the Link Worker Scheme?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) National AIDS Control Programme (NACP)

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The Link Worker Scheme is a component of the National AIDS Control Programme (NACP), designed to enhance HIV prevention, care, and support at the community level by targeting high-risk groups in rural settings.

questions.text: A 24-year-old woman presents to the clinic seeking a medical abortion. According to the current GoI guidelines, which regimen is recommended for a medical abortion up to 7 weeks of gestation?

options.label: A
options.text: 200 mg of mifepristone on Day 1 followed by 800 μg of misoprostol on Day 3

options.label: B
options.text: 200 mg of mifepristone on Day 1 followed by 400 μg of misoprostol on Day 3

options.label: C
options.text: 400 mg of mifepristone on Day 1 followed by 800 μg of misoprostol on Day 3

options.label: D
options.text: 400 mg of mifepristone on Day 1 followed by 400 μg of misoprostol on Day 3

questions.correct_answer: B. 200 mg of mifepristone on Day 1 followed by 400 μg of misoprostol on Day 3
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) 200 mg of mifepristone on Day 1 followed by 400 μg of misoprostol on Day 3

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Medical abortion regimen by the Government of India for up to 7 weeks of gestation: 200 mg of mifepristone on Day 1, followed by 400 μg of misoprostol on Day 3, with a follow-up on Day 15 to confirm completion.

questions.text: A 30-year-old sociologist is studying changes within a community's socio-economic structure. She is particularly interested in the ability of individuals or groups to move within the social hierarchy based on changes in income, education, and occupation. What term best describes this change?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Social mobility

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Social mobility is the movement of individuals or groups within the social hierarchy, influenced by factors like income, education, and occupation.
  • ➤ Social mobility

questions.text: A public health officer is conducting a survey in a community with a total population of 10,000 people. Among them, 2,000 are children aged 0-6 years. The survey reveals that there are 4,000 literate individuals among those aged 7 years and older. He needs to calculate the effective literacy rate for the community. What is the adult literacy rate in this community?
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ For calculating literacy rates, ensure the denominator includes only the population aged 7 years and above. The formula standardizes literacy measurement across populations and avoids using the total population as a denominator, which results in the outdated "crude literacy rate."

questions.text: A 30-year-old gynecologist is discussing contraceptive effectiveness with a group of 2nd year students. She explains that the effectiveness of a contraceptive method can be measured using the Pearl Index, which indicates the number of pregnancies that occur per 100 woman-years of exposure. In a study, 100 couples used a contraceptive called ‘Z’ continuously for 2 years, and during this period, 20 women became pregnant despite using the contraceptive. What is the Pearl Index of contraceptive ‘Z’?
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The Pearl Index is calculated based on the number of unintended pregnancies per 100 woman-years of exposure, using the formula (Pregnancies×1200)/Total months of exposure. This index is a standard measure for assessing contraceptive effectiveness.

questions.text: A 28-year-old woman presents to the clinic for contraception counseling. She has a significant history. She is considering different contraceptive options and asks about the suitability of using a Copper-T IUD. The physician reviews her medical history and advises against certain contraceptive methods based on her condition. In which of the following conditions is the use of Copper-T contraindicated for this patient?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Trophoblastic disease

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:

questions.text: A 19-year-old girl visits the emergency department seeking advice on post-coital contraception after unprotected intercourse. The physician discusses various options available for emergency contraception. The patient is informed about the effectiveness and appropriate use of each method. Which of the following is NOT considered a post-coital contraceptive?
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Levonorgestrel and certain OCPs are used as post-coital contraceptives, Norgestrel alone is not commonly used for this purpose.
  • ➤ Norgestrel

questions.text: A medical officer is conducting a review meeting with the Auxiliary Nurse Midwives (ANMs) at the block level. During the meeting, he discusses various health indicators, including the crude birth rate (CBR) and the expected number of pregnancies. He explains that understanding these numbers is essential for planning and resource allocation. One of the subcenters has a crude birth rate (CBR) of 20 per 1000 people. What is the minimum expected number of pregnancies that should be registered with that ANM?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) 55

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ For expected pregnancy registrations, calculate the births based on CBR, add 10% for wastage, and ensure that at least 50% of this total is registered by the ANM.
  • ➤ For expected pregnancy registrations, calculate the births based on CBR, add 10% for wastage, and ensure that at least 50% of this total is registered by the ANM.

questions.text: A 29-year-old mother brings her 6-month-old baby to the pediatric clinic for a routine check-up. During the visit, she asks about the benefits and properties of breast milk compared to formula. The pediatrician explains various aspects of breast milk, including its nutritional content, absorption rates, and benefits for the baby's growth and development. However, one of the statements about breast milk is not true. Which of the following statements about breast milk is not true?

options.label: A
options.text: Maximum output is at 12 months of lactation

options.label: C
options.text: Calcium utilization is more than cow's milk

options.label: D
options.text: Breast milk contains high amounts of lactose

questions.correct_answer: A. Maximum output is at 12 months of lactation
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Understand that breast milk production peaks around 5 to 6 months post-delivery, after which complementary feeding begins, reducing milk output. Breast milk offers high bioavailability of nutrients, such as iron and calcium, and contains high lactose levels beneficial for infant health.

questions.text: A 2-year-old boy is brought to the pediatric clinic for evaluation of malnutrition. His current weight is 7 kg and his length is 74 cm. The expected (median) weight for his height is 9 kg, and the expected height for his age is 86 cm. The pediatrician uses the WHO classification of undernutrition to determine the severity of his condition. According to the WHO classification of undernutrition, which of the following is the correct category for this child?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Wasted, stunted

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Moderate and Severe Malnutrition Classification
  • ➤ Moderate and Severe Malnutrition Classification

questions.text: A 40-year-old woman works as a school teacher and engages in moderate physical activity throughout the day. She visits the clinic for a routine health check-up and asks for dietary advice. The nutritionist assesses her activity level and provides a recommendation for her daily caloric intake. What is the recommended daily energy intake for an adult woman engaged in moderate work?
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ An adult woman engaged in moderate work typically requires around 2230 kcal per day to meet her energy needs.
  • ➤ 2230 kcal per day

questions.text: Which of the following nutrients is golden rice specifically rich in?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Beta-carotene and Iron

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Golden rice is specifically rich in beta-carotene , making it a valuable food source for addressing vitamin A deficiency, particularly in regions where rice is a staple food.
  • ➤ beta-carotene

questions.text: A 34-year-old man presents to the clinic with complaints of poor wound healing, erythematous scaly pustular lesions around the perioral region, and episodes of diarrhea. His dietary history reveals that he has been consuming a diet lacking in certain essential nutrients. The physician suspects a deficiency of a specific nutrient that could be causing these symptoms. Which nutrient deficiency is most likely responsible for his symptoms?
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Zinc deficiency often presents with poor wound healing, skin lesions around body orifices, and gastrointestinal symptoms such as diarrhea.
  • ➤ Zinc deficiency

questions.text: Match List A (foods) with List B (Rich in nutrients) and select the correct answer using the codes given below:
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Familiarize yourself with the primary nutrients associated with common foods:
  • ➤ Papaya (vitamin A) Soya beans (protein) Ragi (calcium) Amla (vitamin C).
  • ➤ Papaya (vitamin A)
  • ➤ Soya beans (protein)
  • ➤ Ragi (calcium)
  • ➤ Amla (vitamin C).

questions.text: A 42-year-old woman from a dry state presents to the clinic with complaints of weakness in both lower limbs, nausea, and fatigue. She reports that these symptoms have progressively worsened over time, and she is now completely unable to walk. Her medical history reveals that she has been ingesting rye for a long period. What is the most likely cause of her symptoms?
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Ergot alkaloid toxicity from contaminated rye causes ergotism, characterized by vascular and neurological symptoms, and may lead to gangrene or paralysis.
  • ➤ Ergot alkaloid toxicity

questions.text: A 30-year-old sociologist is explaining different types of social groups during a community study. She describes a particular type of group that is unstable and emotional, usually temporary, and typically has a leader who influences its actions. What is this type of social group known as?
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ A mob is a social group that is temporary, highly emotional, and leader-driven, often leading to spontaneous and sometimes destructive actions.
  • ➤ mob

questions.text: A public health officer is training a group of new health inspectors on proper procedures for collecting water samples for bacteriological examination to assess the quality of drinking water. He emphasizes the importance of following the correct method to avoid contamination and ensure accurate results. Which of the following is the correct method for collecting a tap water sample for bacteriological examination?

options.label: A
options.text: Collect water sample from a leaking tap

options.label: B
options.text: Attach bottle before turning on the tap to avoid splashing

options.label: C
options.text: Allow water to flow for 1 minute, then collect water

options.label: D
options.text: Collect sample from a gentle stream of water to avoid splashing

questions.correct_answer: D. Collect sample from a gentle stream of water to avoid splashing
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Use a clean, sterilized bottle. Choose a properly maintained, non-leaking tap. Allow water to flow for 2–3 minutes to flush out contaminants. Collect the sample from a gentle stream to avoid splashing and contamination.
  • ➤ Use a clean, sterilized bottle.
  • ➤ Choose a properly maintained, non-leaking tap.
  • ➤ Allow water to flow for 2–3 minutes to flush out contaminants.
  • ➤ Collect the sample from a gentle stream to avoid splashing and contamination.

questions.text: Which of the following characteristics differentiate slow sand filters from rapid sand filters? Bacteria are removed more effectively Skilled person is needed Cost of construction is cheaper Sand particles are of smaller size Longer duration is needed
questions.explanation: Ans.

questions.text: What is the SI unit used to measure the brightness of a point source of light?
questions.explanation: Ans.

questions.text: Which of the following is not used to express the strength of sewage?
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The strength of sewage is evaluated by BOD, COD, and suspended particles , while E. coli count is used to assess contamination by fecal matter.
  • ➤ BOD, COD, and suspended particles
  • ➤ E. coli count

questions.text: Match the following methods of mosquito control with their examples:
questions.explanation: Ans. D) A-III, B-II, C-IV, D-I

questions.text: The organism given in the image transmits the following diseases except: Murine typhus Pneumonic plague Chiggerosis Hymenolepis diminuta
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Fleas are vectors for diseases like murine typhus and certain types of plague (such as bubonic and septicemic), but they do not transmit respiratory illnesses like pneumonic plague or gastrointestinal infections like Hymenolepis diminuta.

questions.text: A public health researcher is conducting a comparative study on the effectiveness of different mosquito preventive nets in a malaria-endemic region. The study evaluates various features and standards to determine the most effective type of net for reducing malaria transmission. Which of the following statements about mosquito preventive nets is incorrect based on the study's findings?

options.label: A
options.text: Hole size should be less than 0.0475 inches

options.label: B
options.text: The net should have 150 holes per square inch

options.label: C
options.text: The best pattern for the net is circular

options.label: D
options.text: There should be no rent (tears) in the net

questions.correct_answer: C. The best pattern for the net is circular
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) The best pattern for the net is circular.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective
  • ➤ Rectangular Nets are preferred for optimal mosquito prevention, with specific standards for hole size and density to prevent malaria transmission.
  • ➤ Rectangular Nets

questions.text: Based on the standard guidelines for biomedical waste management, in which of the following BMW bags should culture plates be disposed of?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Yellow bag

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In biomedical waste management, culture plates and other microbiological waste should be disposed of in the yellow bag due to the risk of infection from biological materials.
  • ➤ culture plates
  • ➤ yellow bag

questions.text: Assertion (A): WHO recommends Typhoid vaccine for prophylaxis in disaster management. Reasoning (R): Vaccines are cost-effective measures of reducing disease outbreak post disaster. Use the following key to mark the correct answer:

options.label: A
options.text: A and R are true statements AND R is the correct explanation of A.

options.label: B
options.text: A and R are true statements BUT R is not the correct explanation of A.

options.label: C
options.text: A is true BUT R is false.

options.label: D
options.text: Both A and R are false.

questions.correct_answer: D. Both A and R are false.
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Both A and R are false.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective
  • ➤ In disaster management, measles vaccination is prioritized over other vaccines, and chlorination and sanitation are the most cost-effective methods for preventing disease outbreaks.
  • ➤ measles vaccination
  • ➤ chlorination and sanitation

questions.text: A medical researcher is studying various types of pneumoconiosis and their associated clinical disorders. Match the following pneumoconiosis with their respective clinical associations:
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) A-2, B-4, C-1, D-3

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:

questions.text: A factory manager is evaluating different metrics to assess various aspects of the workforce and workplace. One of the metrics being considered is sickness absenteeism. Sickness absenteeism is a useful index to assess:

options.label: D
options.text: State of health of the workers

questions.correct_answer: D. State of health of the workers
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) State of health of the workers

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Sickness absenteeism is a useful metric for assessing the state of health of workers and may indirectly reflect workplace conditions or health-related factors affecting employees.
  • ➤ Sickness absenteeism
  • ➤ state of health of workers

questions.text: A genetics student is learning about the Human Genome Project (HGP) and its outcomes. Which of the following statements regarding the Human Genome Project is false. Use the following key to mark the correct answer: HGP is a collaboration of many countries. More than 20,500 genes were identified. It uses modern next-generation sequencing techniques. It took more than 2 decades to complete.
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) 3 and 4

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The Human Genome Project used classical sequencing techniques and was completed within 14 years , identifying approximately 20,500 genes .
  • ➤ Human Genome Project
  • ➤ 14 years
  • ➤ 20,500 genes

questions.text: A technology company is committed to implementing sustainable practices and reducing its environmental footprint. As part of their green initiative, they need to determine the best method for disposing of obsolete electronic equipment. Based on environmental sustainability practices, what is the best way to dispose of e-waste?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Recycling

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Recycling is the most environmentally responsible method for disposing of e-waste, as it conserves resources and minimizes pollution.
  • ➤ Recycling

questions.text: A hospital administrator is training new medical staff on effective communication protocols. One of the protocols being taught is the SPIKES protocol. For what purpose is the SPIKES protocol used?

options.label: B
options.text: Communication with patients/attendants regarding bad news

questions.correct_answer: B. Communication with patients/attendants regarding bad news
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Communication with patients/attendants regarding bad news

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The SPIKES protocol is used to guide healthcare providers in effectively and empathetically delivering bad news to patients and their families

questions.text: A public health officer is outlining the responsibilities of a male health worker in a community health center. Which of the following are included in the job duties of a male health worker. Use the following key to mark the correct answer: Sputum collection ORS distribution DOTS supervision Growth monitoring Environmental sanitation
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) 1, 2, 3, 5

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Male health workers in community health settings are responsible for tasks like sputum collection, ORS distribution, DOTS supervision, and environmental sanitation, while growth monitoring is typically assigned to female health workers.

questions.text: A health economist is evaluating different indicators to determine the most comprehensive measure of cost-effectiveness in healthcare interventions. Which of the following is the most comprehensive indicator of cost-effectiveness analysis?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) QALYs gained

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ QALYs (Quality-Adjusted Life Years) gained is the most comprehensive indicator in cost-effectiveness analysis as it combines both the quantity and quality of life, providing a balanced measure for evaluating healthcare interventions.

questions.text: All of the following statements about the categories of bioterrorism agents are true except:

options.label: C
options.text: Category C is new emerging pathogens

options.label: D
options.text: Category D is highly lethal agents

questions.correct_answer: D. Category D is highly lethal agents
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Category D is highly lethal agents

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Bioterrorism agents are classified into Categories A, B, and C based on their threat level and potential impact, with Category A being the most dangerous. There is no Category D in the bioterrorism classification.

questions.text: A healthcare analyst is tasked with summarizing and presenting data from a recent patient survey on hospital satisfaction. The analyst needs to categorize the methods used to describe the collection of this data. Under which category do these methods fall?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Descriptive statistics

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Descriptive statistics is used for organizing, summarizing, and presenting data, employing measures of central tendency, dispersion, and visual tools like charts and graphs to communicate data insights effectively.

questions.text: A data scientist is analyzing various methods to study the relationship between two variables. All of the following methods show the relationship between two variables, except:
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Line diagram

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Line diagrams are typically used to show trends in a single variable over time, whereas correlation coefficients, regression, and scatter diagrams are methods that depict the relationship between two variables.

questions.text: During a health screening event, a nutritionist is reviewing the recorded weights of a group of 10 children. The initial analysis showed that the average weight was 18.2 kg. However, it was later discovered that the weight of one child was incorrectly recorded as 2.0 kg instead of the accurate 20 kg. What is the true average weight of the group?
questions.explanation: Ans. D) 20 kg

questions.text: An epidemiologist is preparing to calculate the sample size needed for a prevalence study. All of the following factors are necessary for this calculation except:
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Desired precision

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Desired Precision is not typically essential for a sample size calculation in a basic prevalence study. The primary components are prevalence, significance level, and, in some cases, power, depending on study design .
  • ➤ Desired Precision
  • ➤ .

questions.text: A genetic counselor is analyzing the birth weight probabilities for Mrs. Rekha, who is expecting a baby. Based on her family history and health records, the probability of having a baby with a birth weight (BW) less than 2500 grams is 0.50, and the probability of having a baby with a BW between 2500 and 2999 grams is 0.20. What is the probability that Mrs. Rekha will have a baby with a BW less than 3 kg?
questions.explanation: Ans. B) 0.70

questions.text: The life cycle shown in the image above represents which of the following?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Plasmodium

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The unique stages of the Plasmodium life cycle, including the exoerythrocytic (liver) and erythrocytic (blood) phases, which distinguish it from viral pathogens transmitted by mosquitoes.

questions.text: A researcher is designing a study to test various hypotheses about health outcomes. For which of the following hypotheses would the chi-square test be most appropriate?

options.label: A
options.text: The mean NEET PG score of Delhi students is greater than that of Mumbai students

options.label: B
options.text: A smaller proportion of people who were immunized against chickenpox subsequently develop zoster than those who were not immunized

options.label: C
options.text: The mean blood pressure of black and white male-hypertensive patients taking ACE inhibitors is the same as that of black and white female-hypertensive patients taking ACE inhibitors and that of black and white males and females taking diuretics and placebos

options.label: D
options.text: The mean cost of treating a patient with coronary artery disease with angioplasty is greater than the mean cost of providing medical treatment

questions.correct_answer: B. A smaller proportion of people who were immunized against chickenpox subsequently develop zoster than those who were not immunized
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) A smaller proportion of people who were immunized against chickenpox subsequently develop zoster than those who were not immunized

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The chi-square test is most suitable for analyzing categorical data involving proportions or frequencies across groups. For hypotheses involving means or standard deviations , parametric tests like t-tests or ANOVA are more appropriate.
  • ➤ categorical data
  • ➤ means or standard deviations

questions.text: Two pharmaceutical companies, Pharma A and Pharma B, conducted studies to evaluate the effectiveness of their new drugs in treating a specific disease. In Study A conducted by Pharma A, the 'p' value was 0.02, while in Study B conducted by Pharma B, the 'p' value was 0.001. Both studies used different statistical tests (Test X for Study A and Test Y for Study B) with control groups. The confidence limit for both studies is set within 95%. The analysis of the above data is as follows. Which of the following options is correct? Study B is more precise than Study A, and Test Y is more significant compared to Test X. Study A is more precise than Study B, and Test X is more significant compared to Test Y. Both Test X and Test Y show the same variation, but Study B is more significant than Study A. Both Study A and Study B show significant variation, and both tests have similar statistical significance.
questions.correct_answer: B. A and C are correct
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) A and C are correct

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ A smaller p-value indicates higher significance and precision in results. In comparisons between studies, a p-value lower than 0.05 indicates significance, but a lower p-value among significant values (e.g., 0.001 vs. 0.02) reflects greater statistical strength or precision.
  • ➤ smaller p-value indicates higher significance and precision

questions.text: Identify the scientist in the given photograph:
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) James Lind

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ James Lind’s contribution to clinical trials and scurvy prevention through vitamin C.

questions.text: During a routine quality control check in a public health clinic, the health worker needs to verify the usability of Oral Polio Vaccine (OPV) vials before administering them to children. The Vaccine Vial Monitor (VVM) indicator on each vial is used to determine whether the vial has been exposed to excessive heat and is therefore unusable. Which of the following OPV vials are suitable for use?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Only 1, 2

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The Vaccine Vial Monitor (VVM) is a key indicator of heat exposure in vaccines. Only vials with an inner square lighter than the outer circle should be administered, ensuring the vaccine’s potency and effectiveness.
  • ➤ Vaccine Vial Monitor (VVM)
  • ➤ lighter than the outer circle

questions.text: In a diagnostic test for cancer, the cut-off value is set at point A, as shown in the diagram. Based on this cut-off value, the test will have:
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) High Sensitivity

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The cut-off point in diagnostic tests affects sensitivity and specificity. Setting a cut-off to capture all disease-positive cases increases sensitivity but may reduce specificity by allowing more False Positives.
  • ➤ sensitivity
  • ➤ specificity
